body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of Oregon:
examples: The US Forest Service goes one-on-one with a pest to save ancient pines at Crater Lake National Park.

The snow-covered evergreen trees around Crater Lake National Park may be miles from civilization, but they still contain industrial PCBs, the banned pesticide DDT, and at least two currently used pesticides.
